title: LFortran on Apple Silicon
body:
*Original issue*: https://gitlab.com/lfortran/lfortran/-/issues/265

I installed Conda for Apple Silicon, installed `llvmdev` and used the following tarball: https://lfortran.github.io/tarballs/dev/lfortran-0.9.0-205-g69d3bebd.tar.gz

and things work! Here is an example:

```
$ cat examples/expr2.f90 
program expr2
implicit none

integer :: x

x = (2+3)*5
print *, x
print *, sin(3.5)

end program
$ ./src/bin/lfortran examples/expr2.f90 
$ ./a.out 
25
-0.350783
$ file a.out
a.out: Mach-O 64-bit executable arm64
$ otool -L a.out
a.out:
	[@ rpath](https://gitlab.com/rpath)/liblfortran_runtime.dylib (compatibility version 0.0.0, current version 0.0.0)
	/usr/lib/libSystem.B.dylib (compatibility version 1.0.0, current version 1292.60.1)
```
Even the runtime library got linked correctly. 

The only issue I found is that the `re2c` program is missing in Conda on Apple Silicon, so that's why I had to use the release tarball.

I will use this issue to document how to get things up and running and we should document it in our documentation.
